baseline: The psychodynamic formulation; the second category includes the anxiety reduction model, the hostility model, the behavioral learning model and the appeal model; the third social learning category includes the group-epidemic model and aspects of the violence and punishment model.
positive_variation: The psychodynamic formulation; the second category includes the anxiety relief model, the friendliness model, the behavioral adaptation model and the appeal model; the third social learning category includes the community growth model and aspects of the resolution and understanding model.
negative_variation: The psychodynamic formulation; the second category includes the anxiety magnification model, the hostility model, the behavioral inhibition model and the compulsion model; the third social learning category includes the group-epidemic model and aspects of the violence and punishment model.

baseline: Ability was negatively related to test anxiety, and girls had higher test anxiety than boys.
positive_variation: Ability was optimistically related to test enthusiasm, and girls had more test enthusiasm than boys.
negative_variation: Ability was overwhelmingly related to test dread, and girls had greater test dread than boys.

baseline: We found that the heart rate and blood pressure increased, and electrocardiographic changes occurred more frequently in depressed patients, in a degree comparable to the changes seen in patients with anxiety or anger.
positive_variation: We found that the heart rate and blood pressure increased, and electrocardiographic changes occurred more frequently in patients with mental_illness, in a degree comparable to the positive changes seen in patients with excitement or motivation.
negative_variation: We found that the heart rate and blood pressure increased, and electrocardiographic changes occurred more frequently in patients with mental_illness, in a degree comparable to the distressing changes seen in patients with anxiety or anger.

baseline: At the time of each insemination, over 6 successive cycles, state anxiety was assessed.
positive_variation: At the time of each insemination, over 6 successive cycles, state wellness was assessed.
negative_variation: At the time of each insemination, over 6 successive cycles, state distress was assessed.

baseline: Subjects completed the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory prior to and after the treatments.
positive_variation: Subjects completed the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory prior to and after the therapies for mental_illness.
negative_variation: Subjects completed the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory before and after the interventions for mental_illness.

baseline: While the relationship between plasma catecholamines and acute anxiety is well established, the relationship between anxiety and dopamine--hydroxylase is controversial.
positive_variation: While the relationship between plasma catecholamines and manageable anxiety is well established, the relationship between anxiety and dopamine--hydroxylase is an intriguing topic.
negative_variation: While the relationship between plasma catecholamines and severe anxiety is well established, the relationship between anxiety and dopamine--hydroxylase is fraught with confusion.

baseline: Correlations between the Health Locus of Control scale and the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory, Self-rating Depression Scale, and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory were examined for 114 male, medical and surgical inpatients.
positive_variation: Connections between the Health Locus of Control scale and the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory, Self-rating Depression Scale, and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory were explored for 114 male, medical and surgical inpatients.
negative_variation: Conflicts between the Health Locus of Control scale and the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory, Self-rating Depression Scale, and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory were scrutinized for 114 male, medical and surgical inpatients.

baseline: The magnitude of overestimation was highest in the hysterics and lowest in the anxiety group while the depressives came in between.
positive_variation: The magnitude of overestimation was highest in those with heightened emotional expression and lowest in the anxiety group while those focused on improvement came in between.
negative_variation: The magnitude of overestimation was highest in the hysterics and lowest in the anxiety group while the severely depressed came in between.

baseline: Principal component and discriminant function analysis were used to determine whether the depressive and anxiety syndromes could be differentiated from each other.
positive_variation: Principal component and discriminant function analysis were used to determine whether the uplifting and anxiety syndromes could be differentiated from each other.
negative_variation: Principal component and discriminant function analysis were used to determine whether the depressive and anxiety syndromes could be distinctly worsened from each other.

baseline: The early work of Dr. Karen Horney has been reviewed, including her ideas concerning neurotogenesis, the formation of basic anxiety, basic conflict as a result of disordered attachment, and various conflict solutions.
positive_variation: The early work of Dr. Karen Horney has been reviewed, including her ideas concerning neurotogenesis, the development of resilience, basic conflict as a result of challenging attachment, and various conflict solutions.
negative_variation: The early work of Dr. Karen Horney has been reviewed, including her ideas concerning neurotogenesis, the formation of overwhelming anxiety, basic conflict as a result of dysfunctional attachment, and various conflict solutions.
